abstract: Bear Stearns shareholders suing over the planned JPMorgan Chase takeover are dropping efforts to block the deal but will seek damages of at least $2.8 billion, an attorney for the plaintiffs said on Wednesday.
lead_paragraph: Bear Stearns shareholders suing over the planned JPMorgan Chase takeover are dropping efforts to block the deal but will seek damages of at least $2.8 billion, an attorney for the plaintiffs said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Bear Investors Drop Suit to Block JPMorgan Deal

abstract: JPMorgan Chase, which is buying Bear Stearns, expects to regain business from Bear clients who stopped doing business with the troubled investment bank, JPMorgan’s co-chief executive of investment banking said on Wednesday.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase, which is buying Bear Stearns, expects to regain business from Bear clients who stopped doing business with the troubled investment bank, JPMorgan’s co-chief executive of investment banking said on Wednesday.

abstract: JPMorgan Chase just moved closer to swallowing Bear Stearns, but a few holdouts still hope to spoil Jamie Dimon’s meal.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase just moved closer to swallowing Bear Stearns, but a few holdouts still hope to spoil Jamie Dimon’s meal.

headline.main: Holdouts Still Seek to Block Bear Deal
